verses.text_plain: Now the Lord had said unto Abram, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father’s house, unto a land that I will shew thee:
verses.verse_html: 1Now the Lord had said unto Abram, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father’s house, unto a land that I will shew thee:

verses.text_plain: And I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing:
verses.verse_html: 2And I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing:

tokens.text: And I will make of thee
and thou shalt be a blessing

verses.text_plain: And I will bless them that bless thee, and curse him that curseth thee: and in thee shall all families of the earth be blessed.
verses.verse_html: 3And I will bless them that bless thee, and curse him that curseth thee: and in thee shall all families of the earth be blessed.

tokens.text: thee: and in thee shall all families

verses.text_plain: So Abram departed, as the Lord had spoken unto him; and Lot went with him: and Abram was seventy and five years old when he departed out of Haran.
verses.verse_html: 4So Abram departed, as the Lord had spoken unto him; and Lot went with him: and Abram was seventy and five years old when he departed out of Haran.

verses.text_plain: And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother’s son, and all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls that they had gotten in Haran; and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan; and into the land of Canaan they came.
verses.verse_html: 5And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother’s son, and all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls that they had gotten in Haran; and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan; and into the land of Canaan they came.

verses.text_plain: And Abram passed through the land unto the place of Sichem, unto the plain of Moreh. And the Canaanite was then in the land.
verses.verse_html:
6And Abram passed through the land unto the place of Sichem, unto the plain of Moreh. And the Canaanite was then in the land. ▼
▼ plain: Heb. plains

verses.text_plain: And the Lord appeared unto Abram, and said, Unto thy seed will I give this land: and there builded he an altar unto the Lord, who appeared unto him.
verses.verse_html: 7And the Lord appeared unto Abram, and said, Unto thy seed will I give this land: and there builded he an altar unto the Lord, who appeared unto him.

verses.text_plain: And he removed from thence unto a mountain on the east of Beth–el, and pitched his tent, having Beth–el on the west, and Hai on the east: and there he builded an altar unto the Lord, and called upon the name of the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 8And he removed from thence unto a mountain on the east of Beth–el, and pitched his tent, having Beth–el on the west, and Hai on the east: and there he builded an altar unto the Lord, and called upon the name of the Lord.

verses.text_plain: And Abram journeyed, going on still toward the south.
verses.verse_html:
9And Abram journeyed, going on still toward the south. ▼
▼ going…: Heb. in going and journeying

footnotes.body_text: ▼ going…: Heb. in going and journeying
footnotes.body_html: ▼ going…: Heb. in going and journeying

verses.text_plain: And there was a famine in the land: and Abram went down into Egypt to sojourn there; for the famine was grievous in the land.
verses.verse_html: 10And there was a famine in the land: and Abram went down into Egypt to sojourn there; for the famine was grievous in the land.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when he was come near to enter into Egypt, that he said unto Sarai his wife, Behold now, I know that thou art a fair woman to look upon:
verses.verse_html: 11And it came to pass, when he was come near to enter into Egypt, that he said unto Sarai his wife, Behold now, I know that thou art a fair woman to look upon:

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when

verses.text_plain: Therefore it shall come to pass, when the Egyptians shall see thee, that they shall say, This is his wife: and they will kill me, but they will save thee alive.
verses.verse_html: 12Therefore it shall come to pass, when the Egyptians shall see thee, that they shall say, This is his wife: and they will kill me, but they will save thee alive.

tokens.text: Therefore it shall come to pass, when the Egyptians
me, but they will save thee alive

verses.text_plain: Say, I pray thee, thou art my sister: that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my soul shall live because of thee.
verses.verse_html: 13Say, I pray thee, thou art my sister: that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my soul shall live because of thee.

tokens.text: with me for thy sake; and my soul

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, that, when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair.
verses.verse_html: 14And it came to pass, that, when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, that, when Abram

verses.text_plain: The princes also of Pharaoh saw her, and commended her before Pharaoh: and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s house.
verses.verse_html: 15The princes also of Pharaoh saw her, and commended her before Pharaoh: and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s house.

verses.text_plain: And he entreated Abram well for her sake: and he had sheep, and oxen, and he asses, and menservants, and maidservants, and she asses, and camels.
verses.verse_html: 16And he entreated Abram well for her sake: and he had sheep, and oxen, and he asses, and menservants, and maidservants, and she asses, and camels.

tokens.text: for her sake: and he had sheep

verses.text_plain: And the Lord plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai Abram’s wife.
verses.verse_html: 17And the Lord plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai Abram’s wife.

verses.text_plain: And Pharaoh called Abram, and said, What is this that thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy wife?
verses.verse_html: 18And Pharaoh called Abram, and said, What is this that thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy wife?

tokens.text: unto me? why didst thou not tell

verses.text_plain: Why saidst thou, She is my sister? so I might have taken her to me to wife: now therefore behold thy wife, take her, and go thy way.
verses.verse_html: 19Why saidst thou, She is my sister? so I might have taken her to me to wife: now therefore behold thy wife, take her, and go thy way.

verses.text_plain: And Pharaoh commanded his men concerning him: and they sent him away, and his wife, and all that he had.
verses.verse_html: 20And Pharaoh commanded his men concerning him: and they sent him away, and his wife, and all that he had.

tokens.text: concerning him: and they sent him away
